title: Plants & Photosynthesis Practice Exam
description: Test your knowledge about plants and how they make food

questions.question: What is the process called when plants make their own food?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process plants use to make food using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide.

questions.question: Roots help anchor the plant in the ground and absorb water from the soil.
questions.explanation: Roots have two main jobs: they hold the plant in place and absorb water and nutrients from the soil.

questions.question: What gas do plants take in from the air during photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Plants take in carbon dioxide from the air and use it along with water and sunlight to make food.

questions.question: The green substance in leaves that absorbs sunlight is called _______.
questions.explanation: Chlorophyll is the green pigment in leaves that captures sunlight energy for photosynthesis.

questions.question: Which part of the plant makes food through photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Leaves are where photosynthesis happens. They contain chlorophyll that absorbs sunlight to make food.

questions.question: Plants release carbon dioxide during photosynthesis.
questions.explanation: Plants release oxygen during photosynthesis, not carbon dioxide. They take in carbon dioxide and release oxygen.

questions.question: What do plants need from the sun to make food?
questions.explanation: Plants need light energy (sunlight) to power the process of photosynthesis.

questions.question: Name two reasons why plants are important for life on Earth.
questions.correctAnswer: They produce oxygen and provide food
questions.explanation: Plants are important because they produce oxygen that we breathe and provide food for humans and animals. Other correct answers include: clean the air, provide homes for animals, or prevent soil erosion.
